TreEvo
  • Reference

Simulate data for initial TreEvo analysis

This is a wrapper function for simulateData that allows for multithreading and checkpointing

parallelSimulation(nrepSim, coreLimit, taxon.df, phy, startingPriorsValues,
  intrinsicPriorsValues, extrinsicPriorsValues, startingPriorsFns,
  intrinsicPriorsFns, extrinsicPriorsFns, freevector, timeStep, intrinsicFn,
  extrinsicFn, multicore, checkpointFile = NULL, checkpointFreq = 24,
  niter.brown = 25, niter.lambda = 25, niter.delta = 25, niter.OU = 25,
  niter.white = 25)

Arguments

nrepSim

Number of simulations
coreLimit

Number of cores to be used
taxon.df

object from getTaxonDFWithPossibleExtinction
phy

Tree (Phylogenetic tree in phylo format)
startingPriorsValues

Matrix with ncol=number of states (characters) at root and nrow=2 (two parameters to pass to prior distribution)
intrinsicPriorsValues

Matrix with ncol=number of states (characters) at root and nrow=2 (two parameters to pass to prior distribution)
extrinsicPriorsValues

Matrix with ncol=number of states (characters) at root and nrow=2 (two parameters to pass to prior distribution)
startingPriorsFns

Vector containing names of prior distributions to use for root states: can be one of fixed, uniform, normal, lognormal, gamma, exponential
intrinsicPriorsFns

Vector containing names of prior distributions to use for root states: can be one of fixed, uniform, normal, lognormal, gamma, exponential
extrinsicPriorsFns

Vector containing names of prior distributions to use for root states: can be one of fixed, uniform, normal, lognormal, gamma, exponential
freevector

A vector (length=number of parameters) of free (T) and fixed (F) parameters
timeStep

This value corresponds to the number of discrete time steps
intrinsicFn

Name of intrinsic function characters should be simulated under (as used by doSimulation)
extrinsicFn

Name of extrinsic function characters should be simulated under (as used by doSimulation)
multicore

Whether to use multicore, default is FALSE
checkpointFile

Optional file name for checkpointing simulations
checkpointFreq

Saving frequency for checkpointing
niter.brown

Number of random starts for BM model (min of 2)
niter.lambda

Number of random starts for lambda model (min of 2)
niter.delta

Number of random starts for delta model (min of 2)
niter.OU

Number of random starts for OU model (min of 2)
niter.white

Number of random starts for white model (min of 2)

Value

Returns matrix of trueFreeValues and summary statistics for simulations

References

O'Meara and Banbury, unpublished

Contents

  • Value

Author

Brian O'Meara and Barb Banbury
